title: 103_s210
content: LIMITATION OF COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS for pay for members of Congress and certain senior federal officials. Members of Congress and certain senior federal officials have limitations on cost-of-living adjustments for pay. The adjustment of annual rates is based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The Ethics Reform Act of 1989 limits cost-of-living adjustments for Members of Congress and senior federal officials based on the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. Adjustments in rates of pay under the General Schedule take effect at the beginning of the fiscal year, with the first adjustment in 1995 and subsequent adjustments every two years thereafter. The annual rate of pay for positions at each level of the Executive Schedule is adjusted based on the most recent percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The adjustment takes effect at the beginning of the fiscal year following adjustments in rates of pay under the General Schedule. The salary of the Vice President is adjusted annually based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum increase under the Social Security Act. The adjustment takes effect at the beginning of the fiscal year following adjustments in the General Schedule rates of pay. The Vice President's salary is adjusted annually based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum increase under the Social Security Act, effective at the start of the fiscal year following adjustments in the General Schedule rates of pay. SEC. 2. LIMITATION ON COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS FOR FEDERAL ANNUITIES FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND CERTAIN SENIOR FEDERAL OFFICIALS. The adjustment for annuities based on creditable service as a Member or in a position under the Executive Schedule shall be the lesser of the percentage adjustment under the section or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The adjustment for annuities based on creditable service as a Member or in a position under the Executive Schedule shall be the lesser of the percentage adjustment under this section or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year.
